list-item.p: In the thumb, how many main dorsal branches of each proper palmar digital artery are there and where do they emerge?

These are all advantages of adipofascial turnover flaps, except:
one-stage surgery with local or regional anesthesia.
suitable for covering of thumb volar defects.
minimal donor site deformity.
sparing of the volar digital arteries.
satisfactory cosmetic results.

True or False? The dorsoradial flap may be used to cover the following defects:
Dorsal defects of the hand
Palmar defects of the wrist
Dorsal defects of the thumb
Dorsal defects of the MPJ of the fingers
All the above
Where is the pivot point of the pedicle of the dorsoradial flap located?

1. What is the genetic inheritance pattern of Dupuytren’s Disease?
Autosomal Dominant
Complex polygenic
Autosomal Recessive
Sex-linked Recessive
What is the increased risk of a brother or sister of a patient with Dupuytren’s disease having the condition, compared to a member of the general public?

How much of the genetic heritability of Dupuytren’s disease is accounted for by currently known genetic loci?
4.5%
12.1%
28.5%
42.1%
